availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Henry Lawrence (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror. Kentucky native. Son of Humphrey Lawrence and Harriet Lawrence. Married to Elizabeth Sholar Lawrence in Trigg County, Kentucky, on November 11, 1841. Father of Margaret Lawrence, Eliza A. Lawrence, and Mary Josephine Lawrence. Married to Mary Guier Lawrence in Trigg County on October 23, 1850. Father of James H. Lawrence, George H. Lawrence, Tavey E. Lawrence, John A. Lawrence, Richard F. Lawrence, and Rufus A. Lawrence. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Juror in the Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County on December 8, 1860.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Canton, p. 58B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 85.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 136.
